ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Strategies
ygData.msgSnippet: Lvl 55 on my enchanter is the best now for killing greens.  I have Area effect Tashani for 45mana and my pet can quad hit for 54.  I have spent the last 2 days
ygData.messageBody:
Lvl 55 on my enchanter is the best now for killing greens. I have Area
effect Tashani for 45mana and my pet can quad hit for 54. I have spent the
last 2 days killing junk in the warrens trying to get non Kos in Paniel.
Not working to well still scowls ready to attack.

On a side note the Kobolds near the king, maybe other places too I'm not
sure, drop some of THE BEST looking weapons in the game. Stats not too good
about like FS but the looks are great. Make wonderful pet weapons, even
though pets duel wield without weapons (except enchanter pets). The Katana
is my favorite followed by a 2hs that looks like the spear graphic but looks
really nice when equipped.

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Friday, March 30, 2001 10:26 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Strategies



I use the root and nuke strategy.
Another fun thing to do for faction or items.
With my cleric I run around hittng polar bear cubs once and get a whole
train of them on me (when I am much higher lvl than them). Once I have about
5 or more I wait til they are all close to me and cast Word of Pain. Then
They all die instantly. So then I gather up their pelts. some of which can
be turned in for quests.
I do something similar with my wizard and orc pawns in Freeport. I use a low
lvl dd spell to lure pawns to me and get a whole bunch around me. This is
good when I am encumbered and cannot chase after them. Once I get them
gathered around I use an AE spell. if they don't all die, I stand in place
and attack the ones that are close to me. If they run I turn to another one
and fight it. Eventulaly they all come back to me. I keep fighting til they
are all laying dead around me. then I loot their corpses and gate back to
Hallard's to deliver pawn picks.
Got my faction up to apprehensive so far.
luv,
-Su

> Do you guys have any strategies that you use?
>

>
> and my best strategy is to fear kite young kodiaks in the commons
>
> and at later levels, I'll be grouping with a rogue so that he can back
stab
